content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted julia code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Regular expression pattern for code fences in markdown
    code_fence_pattern = r"^```julia\n([\s\S]*?)^```\n"m

    # Match all occurrences of code fences in the markdown document
    matches = eachmatch(code_fence_pattern, md)

    # Iterate over the matches and extract the julia code blocks
    for match in matches
        # Get the captured group with the julia code
        julia_code = match.captures[1]

        # Remove the leading and trailing newlines from the code block
        julia_code = strip(String(julia_code))

        # Append the extracted code to the final string
        extracted_code *= julia_code * "\n"
    end

    return extracted_code
end
```
